intro: Navarretia setosissima, commonly known as the woolly navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in coastal and inland areas with mild climates. Navarretia setosissima is known for its ability to bloom profusely in early spring, making it a notable wildflower in its native habitat.
